properties.name: Elliot House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown  4237 Newdale Dr, Los Angeles, CA 900271930. On a small, inclined property in Los Feliz, this house is another classic example of Schindler\'s style. The house was intentionally built to promote the growth of ivy on the property, to offer provicy from the nearby neighbors. The house is an interesting study in geometry, with its dominating horizontal-verticle weaving lines. \'Gesamtkunstwerk\' or \'complete-art work\' emerges here, the old European ideal of building and placing custom furniture to complete the space. Also, notice the matching car port. [L.A. Historic Cultural Monument 690, Declared 02/06/2001]

properties.name: Grokowsky House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 816 Bonita Dr, South Pasadena, CA 910301928. More stucco, redwood and another steep hill site, the signature of Schindler\'s style. The roof appears to be flat, steps up in stages, to match the incline of the hill, thus, allowing light to enter. The main entrance is actually on the top of the hill and the roof of the garage is actually used as a sundeck.

properties.name: Home of Code Masters
properties.description: Posted by ScootdownStarted in 1985 by teenage brothers Richard and David Darling, they are responsible for creating countless hit titles for the early home PC game crowd (Commodore Amstrad, and Spectrum), especially in the UK. They also hired the Oliver Tiwns, who wrote many of the hit titles. They were part of a teenage millionaire club of geeks that created games beyond the coinops and console games and proved that DIY games (by gamers and for gamers) could be profitable.

properties.name: Home of Shigeru Miyamoto
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown Kyoto, JapanSonobe (now Nantan), Kyoto, Japan: the hometown and environment of influence for Shigeru Miyamoto. Often called the "Disney" of Video Games, Shigeru Miyamoto is the humble artist-producer of most of the world\'s most recognized games. Donkey Kong, Mario Brothers, Kirby, Legend of Zelda and more... his games have become a franchise-empire that helped launch Nintendo and even Japanese culture into America\'s homes. In interviews he talks about how his hometown and early childhood memories have been a great influence on several of his games, especially Zelda. Despite his influence and cult fame (see the t-shirts), Miyamoto insists on living a modest life and shys away from attention, focusing more on his ceative endeavors.

properties.name: Home of Tetris
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown Alexey Pazhitnov made Tetris at the Russian Academy of Sciences in Moscow in 1984, behind the Iron Curtain. Back then the KGB was watching any activity in the USSR that was attracting foreign visitors. Alexey\'s video interpretation of the traditional game \'pentominoes,\' led to a secret battle to secure the rights to publish the game and distribute it around the world. Eventually, the game was bundled with Nintendo\'s Game Boy and became one of the biggest games of all time. While the game went on to fame, the humble creator was stuck in Moscow without seeing royalties for his work, until the late 90\'s when he moved to Seattle, WA. First video taken of Alexey by Henk Rogers, in USSR. Tetris Commercial, US Tetris Master Player(?)

properties.name: Howe House

This space had a residential and office space for the owner, Dr. Howe. it has many terraces and is often described as being "wrightian" in its design due to its angles, entrance, and garden court.

properties.name: Manola Court Apartments
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown1811 Edgecliff Dr, Silver Lake, CA 900261926-1928. This apartment building was built for Herman Sachs as business venture. The building marks Schindler\'s departure from using cement construction in favor for wood and stucco. A little path runs through the building, which is built on steep, sloting site. Thus, giving the appearance of a Mediteranean hill town.

properties.name: Nintendo of America
properties.description: Posted by ScootdownHere\'s where the fun started. While floundering to get a hit game in the arcade, they recruited young designer Shirgeru Miyamoto from Japan, who then created Donkey Kong. This saved the company and helped them to develop other popular games and eventually break into an dominate the home console and portable market. Prior to video games, Nintendo created a handmade card game (hanafuda) company in Kyoto, Japan. The rise of Space Invaders inspired them to think outside the deck and get into video games.

properties.name: Oliver House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 2236 Micheltorena Street, Los Angeles, Ca1933-1934. With distant views of both the ocean and the mountians, the U-shaped plan is placed diagonally across a long rectangular site. Features a strong sculpted roof, a signature of Schindler\'s style. The modern interior features built-in furniture.

properties.name: P. Lovell Beach House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown  1242 West Oceanfront, Newport Beach, CA 92661-10271922-1926. Considered Schindler\'s 2nd most important work, this structure is viewed as being one of the most influential works of modernism in the US.

properties.name: Packard House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 931 north Gainsborough Drive, Pasadena, CA, 911071924. Similar to the Schindler/ Chase house on Kings Road. Schindler blurs the line between indoor/ outdoor relationships. He was constricted by local regulations at the time and was forced to use pitched roofs. Otherwise, the structure is very similar to other buildings, with it\'s use of bare concrete and wood.

properties.name: Saarinen Water Tower (AT&T Bell labs, now Lucent)
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown crawford\'s corner road, holmdel, njSaarinen\'s acchitecture is as lovely as it is famous. Here is one of his later, less known projects in Holmdel, NJ 07733, USA. This comlex was a corporate job for Bell labs and was designed to hold over 6,000 employees. It is the birthplace of many inventions and patents as well as home to nobel prize winners. Of more importance, take a look at the ominous water tower, which is the only real structure of the complex that you can see from the surrounding roads. Note, that it looks like a giant transistor! Creepy and cool. Check out website link for details.

properties.name: Schindler / Chace House
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown 835 North Kings Road, Hollywood, California1921-1922. Schindler\'s most important work. it was a collaborative piece between him, his wife, Pauline, and Clyde and Marian Chace. This house became the model for the famous Case Study House Program after WWII. It is now the office for MAK Center for Art and Architecture in Los Angeles, who promote and preserve the work of Austrian architects that contributed to the city.

properties.name: Wolfe House (destroyed)
properties.description: Posted by Scootdown1928-1929. Old Stage Road, Avalon, Catalina Ssland, CA. Schindler\'s most remarkable hillside home, this house was easily seen from the harbor. Built for Ethel and Charles Wolfe, to promote their costume business in Los Angles, it was more of a summer home. All of the projecting roofs are used as decks, once again showing Schindler\'s desire to utalize the exterior spaces of a home. Since Destroyed (Summer 2001).
